styles

Class Property

  • java.lang.Object
    • styles.Property

  • public class Property
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for styles management. A property is a basically a tuple (label, value). Virtually any property is enabled.
    Author:
    Bruno Quercia

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

    • Constructor Detail

      • Property

        public Property(java.lang.String label,
                java.lang.String value,
                java.util.Set<java.lang.String> possibleValues)
        Parameters:
        label - Name of the property (e.g. font-weight)
        value - Value of the property (e.g. bold)
        possibleValues - List of the possible values for attribute value (e.g. ['bold', 'normal', 'light']). value is automatically added to possibleValues.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue()
        Returns:
        the current value of the property.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(java.lang.String v)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets the value of the property
        Parameters:
        v - the new value of the property
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the value is not in the possible values of the property

      • addPossibleValue

        public void addPossibleValue(java.lang.String v)
        Adds a new value the property can be set to
        Parameters:
        v - new possible value

      • isPossibleValue

        public boolean isPossibleValue(java.lang.String v)
        Determines if a value is possible for the property.
        Parameters:
        v - the value.
        Returns:
        if the value is possible.

      • getPossibleValues

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getPossibleValues()
